beer.beer_description:
New Direction is a brand new Northern IPA. What's a Northern IPA you ask, well it's fermented using Lallemand's brand new EXP483 yeast strain. Designed to be the best of both worlds situated right between a West Coast IPA and a New England or East Coast style IPA. So what does that mean? You can expect all the tropical and fruit forward notes from a hazy IPA but the lean and clean body of a West Coast or Cali leaning IPA.

For this New Direction, we've pumped the dry-hop with Citra, Kohia Nelson, and Motueka. On the aromas we're getting loads of lime sorbet, tropical orange and wafts of passionfruit pulp. Take a sip and this baby is downright crushfest. The flavours match the aromas with punchy orange, lime zest and almost pasito like refreshing hit. The body is light and easy to drink, really letting the hops shine. There is a balanced ester profile from the yeast gives just a hint more tropical than your average West Coast ale strain, perfect for the sunny autumn days ahead.

items.checkin_comment: 酸味のあるトロピカル。マウンテンIPAとノーザンIPAって何が違うん？俺の知ってるマウンテンIPAはモルトがもっと立っててクラシカルというかオレゴンぽさが多く感じたがコレはモダンなウエストコーストIPAとヘイジーのあいだと感じた。

items.badge_description: We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 480 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 97! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.checkin_comment:
Another check-in because this is still yummy, no change really, and particularly because I like the label. Range have made a ton of top shelf beers this year but so many of their recent labels look like AI tinsel vomit. 

This is a good one.👍🍻

items.checkin_comment: Has a very interesting smell, more fruity than I would expect from something described as a west coast IPA. It’s good but just doesn’t quite fit into a box nicely

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 145 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 30!

Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 150 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 31! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.checkin_comment: Cloudy mid gold. Loads of zesty mandarin and orange with mellow passionfruit on nose and palate. Full-flavoured, soft smooth mouthfeel, lingering citrus and green tropical fruits. Like this new direction.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

beer.beer_name: Ou Cê Pira Ou Cê Cicaba
